info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 16 at 8:04PM EDT until May 16 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL MECKLENBURG COUNTY... At 804 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles east of Uptown Charlotte, or over Mint Hill, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Uptown Charlotte, East Charlotte, Freedom Park, Reedy Creek Park, The Plaza, Hidden Valley, Southpark Mall, Central Charlotte, South Charlotte and Matthews. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
